categoryRubrics.rule: Generally, the identifiers found within a CDA document should be unique and non-reoccurring within the same document.
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
categoryRubrics.description: EffectiveTime elements in the section are expected to have timeoffsets along with the date and are typically nonzero timeoffsets. In addition they are expected to have the timezone information for proper interpretation.For e.g if the time is being defaulted to 000000 for hours, minutes and seconds for multiple entries it might be worth checking if the data was entered properly. Also if the time offsets are present without a timezone, the time may be interpreted incorrectly, hence timezones should be specified as part of the time element.

categoryRubrics.rule: EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient
categoryRubrics.description: EffectiveDate/Times for historical events should be greater than the patient's date of birth and less than the earliest of current time or patient's date of death.

categoryRubrics.rule: The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology

issuesList.xmlString: <code xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" code="48765-2" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.1" codeSystemName="LOINC" displayName="Allergies, adverse reactions, alerts"/>

categoryRubrics.description: Each of the code systems, value sets specified by the C-CDA IG refers back to standard terminologies like SNOMED-CT, LOINC, RxNorm, ICD9, ICD10. When codes from these codesystems are used to represent structured data the display name corresponding to the code should be used as part of the document

categoryRubrics.rule: Allergies Concern observation effective times reflect the appropriate allergy concern status
categoryRubrics.description: An Allergy Concern of completed or suspended should have an allergy observation effectiveTime/high value present.Similarly an allergy Concern which is Active shall not have an Allergy observation effectiveTime/high value.

categoryRubrics.rule: Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text

issuesList.xmlString:
<act xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" classCode="ACT" moodCode="EVN">
              <templateId extension="2015-08-01" root="2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.30"/>

              <id root="fa382abd-cb54-434b-80b6-504f96ef872d"/>
              <code code="CONC" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.5.6" xsi:type="CE"/>
              <statusCode code="active"/>
              <effectiveTime>
                <low value="20170327200320"/>
              </effectiveTime>
              <entryRelationship typeCode="SUBJ">
                <observation classCode="OBS" moodCode="EVN" negationInd="true">
                  <templateId extension="2014-06-09" root="2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.7"/>
                  <templateId root="2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.7"/>
                  <id root="7ce91eb7-8c9d-42a2-be26-69e41df976cb"/>
                  <code code="ASSERTION" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.5.4" xsi:type="CE"/>
                  <statusCode code="completed"/>
                  <effectiveTime>
                    <low nullFlavor="NA"/>
                  </effectiveTime>
                  <value code="419199007" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.96" codeSystemName="SNOMED CT" displayName="Allergy to substance (disorder)" xsi:type="CD"/>
                  <participant typeCode="CSM">
                    <participantRole classCode="MANU">
                      <playingEntity classCode="MMAT">
                        <code nullFlavor="NA"/>
                      </playingEntity>
                    </participantRole>
                  </participant>
                </observation>
              </entryRelationship>
            </act>

referenceErrors.description: SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] templateId ( CONF:5252, CONF:10036 ) such that it SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @root="2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.1.1"

Consol US Realm Header (V3) SHALL contain at least one [1..*] recordTarget, where its type is Record Target (CONF:1198-5266) each SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] patientRole, where  (CONF:1198-5267) patient Role SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] patient, where  (CONF:1198-5283) each SHOULD contain zero or more [0..*] languageCommunication, where  (CONF:1198-5406) languageCommunication SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] languageCode, which SHALL be selected from ValueSet Language 2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.11526 DYNAMIC (CONF:1198-5407)

Consol US Realm Header (V3) SHALL contain at least one [1..*] recordTarget, where its type is Record Target (CONF:1198-5266) each SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] patientRole, where  (CONF:1198-5267) patient Role SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] patient, where  (CONF:1198-5283) each SHOULD contain zero or more [0..*] languageCommunication, where  (CONF:1198-5406) languageCommunication SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] languageCode, which SHALL be selected from ValueSet Language 2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.11526 DYNAMIC (CONF:1198-5407)

Consol US Realm Header SHALL contain at least one [1..*] recordTarget, where its type is Record Target (CONF:5266) each SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] patientRole, where  (CONF:5268) patient Role SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] patient, where  (CONF:1198-5283) patient SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] maritalStatusCode, which SHALL be selected from ValueSet HL7 Marital Status 2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.12212 DYNAMIC (CONF:5303, R2.1=CONF:1198-5303)

Consol US Realm Header MAY contain zero or one [0..1] dataEnterer, where its type is Data Enterer (CONF:5441) each SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] assignedEntity, where  (CONF:5442) assignedEntity SHALL contain at least one [1..*] addr (CONF:5460, R2.1=CONF:1198-5460)

Consol US Realm Header MAY contain zero or one [0..1] dataEnterer, where its type is Data Enterer (CONF:5441) each SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] assignedEntity, where  (CONF:5442) assignedEntity SHALL contain at least one [1..*] telecom (CONF:5466, R2.1=CONF:1198-5466)

Consol US Realm Header MAY contain zero or one [0..1] dataEnterer, where its type is Data Enterer (CONF:5441) each SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] assignedEntity, where  (CONF:5442) assignedEntity SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] assignedPerson, where its type is Person (CONF:5469, R2.1=CONF:1198-5469)

A compatible R1.1 templateId without an extension must be included in addition to the existing R2.1 templateId with an extension for Reason For Referral Section2 1.3.6.1.4.1.19376.1.5.3.1.3.1:2014-06-09. When asserting this templateId, all C-CDA R2.1 document, section, and entry templates that had a previous version in C-CDA R1.1 SHALL include both the C-CDA R2.1 templateId and the C-CDA R1.1 templateId root without an extension. See C-CDA R2.1 Volume 1 - Design Considerations for additional detail (CONF:1198-32936, CONF:1198-32934, DSTU:757, DSTU:781).

A compatible R1.1 templateId without an extension must be included in addition to the existing R2.1 templateId with an extension for Medical Equipment Section2 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.2.23:2014-06-09. When asserting this templateId, all C-CDA R2.1 document, section, and entry templates that had a previous version in C-CDA R1.1 SHALL include both the C-CDA R2.1 templateId and the C-CDA R1.1 templateId root without an extension. See C-CDA R2.1 Volume 1 - Design Considerations for additional detail (CONF:1198-32936, CONF:1198-32934, DSTU:757, DSTU:781).

A compatible R1.1 templateId without an extension must be included in addition to the existing R2.1 templateId with an extension for Plan Of Treatment Section2 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.2.10:2014-06-09. When asserting this templateId, all C-CDA R2.1 document, section, and entry templates that had a previous version in C-CDA R1.1 SHALL include both the C-CDA R2.1 templateId and the C-CDA R1.1 templateId root without an extension. See C-CDA R2.1 Volume 1 - Design Considerations for additional detail (CONF:1198-32936, CONF:1198-32934, DSTU:757, DSTU:781).
